alert.note: Alert for Calaveras; Stanislaus; Tuolumne (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 11 at 3:08PM PST until March 11 at 6:15PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sacramento has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Stanislaus County in central California... South Central Calaveras County in northern California... Tuolumne County in northern California... * Until 615 PM PST. * At 308 PM PST, Emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Sonora, Jamestown, Tuolumne City. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sonora, Springfield, Tuttletown, Chinese Camp, Vallecito, Carson Hill, Angels City, Long Barn, Copperopolis, Copper Cove Village, Hodson, Telegraph City, East Sonora, Jamestown, Columbia, Phoenix Lake-Cedar, Phoenix Lake-Cedar Ridge, Mono Vista, Soulsbyville and Tuolumne City. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
